intro: Crawfurdia fasciculata var. championii, commonly known as the Cape mountain cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
